I was wondering whether she should simply go for a bilateral and reduce the risk of occurance in the other breast. I know that since she is stage IV already the cancer could be anywhere but would it help to get the other breast out. Just looking for opinions as I wonder about the course of action. Mom DX in Feb'08 with liver mets Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Masectomy - Should we go for bilateral sarika_for_mama sarika_for_mama

Posts.Content: sarika_for_mama wrote: Sorry guys. I promised i would keep in touch but time flies when you are having fun :)  My last post was when my mom was in ICU and we ( my 3 yr old daughter and I) were planning to go spend a couple weeks with her. Well I am happy to report that by the time I got there she was out of the hospital and even came to receive us at the airport. She had energy for the first time in 5 months to play with her grandchild. She was put back on chemo though as the onc didnt want to keep her off too long but she got 10 day rest on her liver and she was back on Xeloda and Taxol. I must say though, i was heartbroken to see her almost bald head and really dark palms and feet. She has lost weight and looked 10 years older. But I am focusing on the positive side that she was happy for the 16 days we spent with her. We bought her a new wig and made plans for when she would come and visit us. She has her scans on July 2nd. We are all nervous again - tummy is all tied up. I am hoping for an excellent result this time. Hope the tumor shrinks to nothing and she gets a break )looooong break). Just thought I would update you all. Lots of love Sarika Mom DX in Feb'08 with liver mets Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I am back from India sarika_for_mama CalGal

Posts.Content: sarika_for_mama wrote: Hello ladies, Yes it has been a while. Well, i had nothing to report but i have been lurking around checking on everyone.  But now i have something to report. It's not good news. After 3 rounds of Avastin & then 6 rounds of Xeloda + Taxol , we went in for scans last week. Results - she is where she was 9 months ago. Except the uptake has increased. The lesion in tumor stayed on and was bright in the PET Scan and also the breast lit up right where it did 9 months ago. the scan we did in the middle had shown considerable improvement so now we were hoping for NED, instead she is at the starting line all over again. ONC says he wont give more chemo and prefers we go for RFA and masectomy. He doesnt seem too enthusiastic anymore. He had taken an agressive approach and now it seems he is giving up on her. Or is he just giving her a break?  Any words of wisdom for us? Thanks Sarika Mom DX in Feb'08 with liver mets Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Hello All - My mom's update sarika_for_mama KiminJax

Posts.Content: sarika_for_mama wrote: This Post was deleted by sarika_for_mama. Mom DX in Feb'08 with liver mets Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Was she ever NED? sarika_for_mama sarika_for_mama

Posts.Content: sarika_for_mama wrote: I lost my mom on august 20th. Some of you might remember my post a few weeks ago when i was in denial and refused to believe my mom was dying. Well you were right. I lost the most beautiful thing in my life. I left the same day the doctors said there was nothing they could do. when i arrived i was devasted to see my mother breathing hard curled up like a bean and reaching out to me. i cried francticaly and she shed a tear so i know she knew it was me even though the doctor said he isnt sure he recognized me. I believe my mama knew i had come. we brought her home and my dad still believed she would come around and I went along with that hope. I know she saw she was in her house, she was satisfied, and then she slept in her bed, on her pillow so soundly that she never woke up. We tried to wake her up at night and only when i yelled "mama" she would respond and open her eyes a little. But only for one night. Then she developed fever and had a brain seizure which we could see on her face. We rushed her back to the hospital and they told us that the medicines we were feeding her from her food tube were not getting absorbed and she wasnt making urine which meant her kidneys were failing. two days  after staying in coma came the dreaded day when we knew she was going to leave us. My dad, sister and my grandmother were by her side when she took her last breath.  She left us and now i dont know what to do with myself. I was her advocate and i feel defeated, i let her slip, maybe i didnt see the clues, where did i go wrong? She was my best friend, my soul mate and i dont have that connection with anyone, how will i live the rest of my life. I searched her house franctically to see if she left me a note, anything in her handwriting, any picture, any last thing she used. I have her last outfit which i will never wash because i can smell her in it. Mama, i love you. Please come to me, talk to me.  Mom DX in Feb'08 with liver mets Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: You were right..... sarika_for_mama sarika_for_mama

Posts.Content: sarika_for_mama wrote: Hello everyone,  My mom Dxed in 2008 has been battling non-stop her liver mets and now recent scans show brain mets along with progression in liver.  She is VERY depressed. Wants to stop treatment and basically die. Some of you might be with her and say "respect her wishes" - but i want to mention that my mom is symptom free. Her LFTs are great, no issues with brain mets and i just went on a nature vacation with her where she walked 6 miles with me and enjoyed her grandkids running behind them. Her body is still strong, HOW DO I LET HER DIE? I want her to fight.  I need your help. I talk to her everyday and am running out of things to say to her to bring her out of her dark place. I am concerned that mentally she is giving up which is half the battle. I need her to beleive in her treatments. I share your success stories everyday but then she shares some sad stories of people passing away around her. Help me with ideas of how to buck her up and get her ready for yet another battle? Mom DX in Feb'08 with liver mets Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: sarika_for_mama wrote: Ladies, My mom is ER+/PR-. The web is giving me a very gloomy picture for prognosis with PR- tumors. Is anyone going through a hormonal treatment that is working for them? Does chemo have different results on different types of ER/PR tumors? I am wondering whether her liver tumor will shrink with chemo or not. My mother is crying hysterically everyday. She is sure her end is near. How can i console her? Please help me this is killing us. How are you guys getting through this. She is going through her treatment but is dying inside everyday. :( Mom DX in Feb'08 with liver mets Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Hormonal treatment for ER+/PR- HER- sarika_for_mama Carmelle

Posts.Content: sarika_for_mama wrote: She says God is out to get her. She thinks - Everyone is laughing at her that she renovated her house when she has this deadly disease. The onc appreciated her outfit yesterday and my mom thinks she was taunting her suggesting she should not be dressed nice when she is about to die. She said "i am a coward - i cant kill myself, why cant i just cut my veins or hang myself and get you all out of this misery." And on this side, here i was listening, dumbfounded, understanding her frusteration but speechless. What can i even say..... Mom DX in Feb'08 with liver mets Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Mom is suicidal sarika_for_mama Lowrider54

Posts.Content: sarika_for_mama wrote: all ready togo for gemzar taxol + herceptin and then the FISH results come in. They say we dont know whether she is Her2+ now. Can they be any more confusing. One onc says FISH is gold std the other says no need for FISH he knows from IHC what to do. Who should we beleive? go through a year of Herceptin on faith? dont use our brain? Help, share your experiencies please. Mom DX in Feb'08 with liver mets Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Is Anyone Taking LifeOne? sarika_for_mama LoriFL

Posts.Content: sarika_for_mama wrote: Hello everyone, I have a heavy heart while i write this. Four years ago when my mom went through her Stage IIIB breast cancer treatment, we had all moved on with our lives thinking that we have beat the beast. But it has sprung it's ugly head again and this time it is stage IV as the doctors have found a 2.5x2.5 cm spot in liver which is ER/PR positive metastasic cancer The doctors have included Avastin in her treatment this time. Several articles on the web talk about the serious side effects and that it has no affect on breast cancer cells. It is discouraging that FDA has not approved it either. If someone has gone through an Avastin treatment for Breast cancer, please share your experience with me. She starts her treatment tomorrow and we would like to be more educated. She will go through 6 cycles of chemo, will she need to take avastin for al 6 cycles? what side effects should we prepare ourselves for? Please respond - enlighten us, we need help/support. Mom DX in Feb'08 with liver mets Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Avastin for breast cancer? sarika_for_mama sarika_for_mama

Posts.Content: sarika_for_mama wrote: Hello all, My mom has lost 1/4 of her hair. It is still not enough to resort to a wig but the thinning is noticable. I was thinking of buying some spray on hair products for her to hide the bald spots. Something like Dermamatch, Good Looking Hair or even the expensive ones like Magic hair or Fabulan. I was hoping to see if any of you ladies have had any experience with these products. Do they work as well as the pics on the web. Even if she can spray it on and look natural for a couple hours, i am ok with that. She is a school teacher and you know the kids can be really mean when they dont understand the circumstances. Please advise. Mom DX in Feb'08 with liver mets Log in to post a reply

The doctors are not treating her with Avastin along with Chemotherapy to shrink her liver mets. Are you going through the same treatment? If you understand the above statement differently, please explain to me. Thanks Mom DX in Feb'08 with liver mets Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Clarification on Avastin - please advise sarika_for_mama KiminJax

Posts.Content: sarika_for_mama wrote: Short update - My mother started Navelbine + Carboplatin + Avastin in Feb. She has gone through two cycles. And in between she is getting Neupogen shots. I must say that this time chemo has been VERY hard on her. She can barely get herself dressed or move from the bed to the chair without getting exhausted. She has been breathing heavily ever since her first Neupogen shot. Even was hospitalized because of SOB. It seems like she was better off without tx. She was doing so well till the first chemo drop entered her body. Wonder if cancer was doing her as much harm as chemo is. Please share your experiences with neupogen. What side effects have you gone through? Mom DX in Feb'08 with liver mets Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Chemo taking a toll on my mother sarika_for_mama RobinWendy

Posts.Content: sarika_for_mama wrote: I found out that my mother is not getting any tumor marker tests. I want to have an intelligent conversation with her onc so please help me. What should i tell him? What tumor marker tests are you guys getting? Are you getting regular PET and CT scans also? I hate CT scans because of the amount of radiation you are exposed to. The onc keeps smiling whenever i want to have a discussion with him. It bugs me too much.  So this time i want to go prepared. I want him to start the tumor marker test. What should i tell him? Posts.Title: Tumor markers - HELP sarika_for_mama LuAnnH

Posts.Content: sarika_for_mama wrote: Hello ladies,  I searched the board for this topic and found a few of you going through this horrible phase. So my mom has been battling stage IV since 2008. After exhasting all chemos and losing 40 pounds i asked her to stop and try something else which wouldnt harm her just to we could keep her stable and try and get her health back. So i brought her to US and she getting immunology treatments in PHX at Envita.  The issue is as soon as she got there she started developing ascites. She has gained 18 pounds in less than a month. Her belly is distended and we started her on diuretics two weeks ago. She is urinating more but still gaining weight. She is frusterated because i got her here to get IV Vitamin C (high doses) and a NK cell treatment and she is refusing IV because it has sodium in it and she is eating even less now because she feels full almost immediately. There is no breathing issues or pain so far. My question is - has diuretics worked on any of you? Should we get her tapped even though we know the fuild will accumulate again? Her liver functions are improving but ascites is not reducing. Her clothes dont fit, she cant walk and cries all the time in frusteration. Please share some stories.  Mom DX in Feb'08 with liver mets Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Ascites and Diuretics sarika_for_mama CoolBreeze
